intro: Vernonia echinops, commonly known as the blueweed or rough blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are rough and hairy, and the flowers are blue to purple in color, blooming in late summer to early fall. Vernonia echinops is known for its drought tolerance and is sometimes used in xeriscaping due to its hardy nature.
